content.webTitle: Trump shrugs as health bill, Priebus go kablooey | The minute

fields.headline: Trump shrugs as health bill, Priebus go kablooey
fields.bodyText: In a dramatic wee-hours vote on Friday, a Republican plan to dismantle the Affordable Care Act collapsed, with three GOP senators – Susan Collins, Lisa Murkowski and John McCain – voting ‘No’. McCain then returned to Arizona for cancer treatment. McCain was last ‘No’ aboard Protesters outside the Capitol sent up a cheer as the imminent threat to Barack Obama’s healthcare law receded. Donald Trump, however, declared that he would now let the law “implode” – perhaps by suspending subsidies or other sabotage. The GOP trio who voted No After weeks of rumors, White House Chief of Staff Reince Priebus got the axe late on Friday, in a Trump tweet, of course. The president replaced Priebus with Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly. In a speech to police officers on Long Island, NY, the president glossed over the failure of health reform, which he had vowed to achieve on “Day One”. “You can’t have everything,” Trump said. Then he gave a horrorshow speech about gangs. Will Trump ‘implode’ Obamacare? Despite the relative current popularity of Obamacare and the failure of either house of Congress to pass a viable replacement bill, the House speaker Paul Ryan said: “I am disappointed and frustrated, but we should not give up.”
